reviewText: one of my favorites

JAWS 2,3, & THE REVENGE are available on blu-ray now with new HD transfers
and i tell you the picture quality for each Jaws films does look fantastic, very sharp & clear quality
much sharper than the very old Digital remaster transfers
the sound quality has also been boosted for each film, only slightly thou
Jaws 2 & 3 has new master audio 2.0 mixes which i think shojuld've been given new 5.1 master mixes
but obviously the universal executives weren't going to make a big effort for the sound quality of each film
but still the new 2.0 master stereo mixes for jaws 2 & 3 does sound pretty Good anyway
better than the old Mono sound mixes, Jaws the revenge has the new 5.1 mix
as for the special features
JAWS 2 blu-ray has no new extras at all, only the exact same extras from the very old dvd version
has been carrived over which is the retrospective making of Documentary, Deleted scenes, Keith Gordon featurette
the John williams featurette, stills Photo Gallery, Theatrical trailer, TV spots
JAWS 3 has no extras either, just the usual Theatrical trailer & Universal have advertised the 3D version as an extra on the back cover
but that's all you going to get
the last Jaws sequel, only has the usual trailer plus never before seen Alternate ending in HD
the Alt ending is pretty much the same as the ending in the film, the only difference is instead of the shark exploding in secs
the shark is seen dieing in slow motion, pretty s*** alt ending if you ask me
so your better off buying the new Jaws sequels on blu-ray for new HD transfers & better sound quality
scrap the old 2015 dvd reissues by Universal, very stupid of them to even reissue them in 3 Disc set
5 stars for all 3 blu-ray versions, 1 star for this 3 disc dvd reissue
Good old time movie
always cool to look back and watch these

to those who are hesitant on a purchase of this new "3 movie collection" - i say buy it if you love the Jaws franchise. there are a few things that make this economically priced set worth it. upon viewing, you will notice that the main title for Jaws 3 has been corrected for the first time in its' home video history (once it soars into frame and bites down, the title now reads JAWS 3-D as opposed to JAWS III)

the image and color tone (as referenced in another review here) has been improved significantly over the quality of the initial dvd release of this film as well. blood is now definitely red, and many things are much more visible than ever before on home video. sound mix seems to be better (more natural)

and one final surprise, during the climax. as the shark approaches the control room window it is now centered and stops without allowing its dorsal fin to hit the top of the frame. this is major considering the original 3D effect depended on this to achieve the illusion.

Jaws: The Revenge has changed tonally as well, and for the better. the Universal logo at the opening has been framed correctly (compare to the original Universal dvd release)

and as another pointed out, the original ending is missing. yet again, we are given the exploding shark.

altogether this is a small step forward for those who champion the sequels (primarily 3D and The Revenge) and at such a cheap price, it would be absurd to avoid this release considering what we all know we would pay for a decent Blu-ray of the same thing.

4 stars**** (5 for 3D and The Revenge) due to Universal's poor choices (revised artwork, JTR ending, etc)
Great collection at a great price
Very satisfied with my purchase

I wasn't expecting a whole lot from this release.  For the most part, I was right.  None the less, I decided to risk the $10 purchase.  If you don't already own the Jaws sequels, it's a good buy.  However, for those of you (like myself), were hoping for extra content, or anything different from the past dvd releases of these movies, you'll be a bit disappointed.  This is a two disc set.  Jaws 2 is its only disc, and it is straight out of the original Jaws 2 dvd release.  Jaws 3 & 4 are put on the second disc.  Zero bonus features.  Jaws the Revenge still has the crappy 4 inch plastic model shark filled with mush exploding at the end, so universal dodged the whole "put the proper ending in" deal.
They did SLIGHTLY modify the tones of 3 & 4 though.  Jaws 3 you can now see that the blood in the water is more red than pink, and you can see Fitzroyce's body in the shark's mouth post death a little clearer.  Jaws 4 it seems, they did some micro editing, taking out milli-seconds of garbage shots.  But the the picture goes from fairly clear to gritty, and seems a little uneven.
Despite the quality of the sequels, they do deserve a blu ray release.  They did absolutely amazing with cleaning up the original Jaws, it would be nice if they restored the sequels....and for crap's sake, put the original theater ending in Jaws The Revenge!!
Hope this helps!

Basically this has Jaws 2, .... and the other two films.
Jaws 2 is a good-not-great film that my Dad took me to see in '78.
First half is excellent (but get the Sackler/Searls novel for a much better story), but the
second half devolves into a "teenagers-on-boats-screaming" flick reminiscent and
characteristic of the times.
Third movie is mostly garbage but occasionally a good laugh (no real 3D possible in
this edition) and "Jaws The Revenge" is as well, except is perhaps one of the
worst films in history.  Watch it to point out everything wrong with it if you want.
To emphasize the importance of each film (perhaps), Jaws 2 is on its own DVD.
"The other 2 films" are on one DVD, no extras or special features for those.
Some of the backstory for Jaws 2 is interesting and worthwhile to watch on that
film's DVD.  In short, get this for Jaws 2.  Watch the other two films more for yucks
than anything else.

Great value to complete the set. But I highly suggest getting the original (that is NOT included in this set) on bluray. The remastering of the bluray copy of the original is nothing short of amazing.

The sequels that you find in this set are fine as DVD as they probably can not be remastered too well because the source material is not that great.
Especially Jaws 3 or its proper name Jaws 3D. When viewing this movie you will notice a good bit of distortion and color issues in the corners. This is because it was supposed to be viewed as a 3D film so the 3D cameras they used cause this issue. The 3D idea also explains the weird floating dead objects that sometimes appear in the film hanging for way too long.. These where supposed to be 3D objects.

Jaws 2 is on its own disk. Jaws 3 and Jaws: The Revenge are on a two side disk together.

I have received an incomplete case twice now on the sequels. I've gotten only two movies out of three. I've yet to receive Jaws 3. I knew that the set did not include the original Jaws. I expected to get Jaws 2,3, And Revenge. I have asked replacement set again. I wish I could just buy Jaws 3 and just be done with it.

Finally the goods ones get their own release and we can ignore the 1979 train wreck that was Jaws. The Jaws sequels built on the mythology that Jaws set up, with out the hokey acting or terrible special effects. I would go so far as to say these three masterpieces are one film, as in a sense the themes of family, fear, and love all run through all three. A great man once said, 'its like poetry, it rhymes,' and that is all to true with the Jaws sequel trilogy. Notice how a shark, the same type of shark, appears in all three. Could this be a coincidence? I would call the Jaws equal trilogy the Cloud Atlas of horror, and fully expect the Wasowskis to announce a Jaws 5 within the decade. Could Jupiter Ascending take place in the same universe as Jaws? Is this what Spielberg intended all along?

Read carefully what you are buying.
